titleStmt.title: A three-fold discourse betweene three neighbours, Algate, Bishopsgate, and John Heyden the late cobler of Hounsditch, a professed Brownist. Whereunto is added a true relation (by way of dittie) of a lamentable fire which happened at Oxford two nights before Christ-tide last, in a religious brothers shop, knowne by the name of Iohn of all-trades.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Cowles, T. Bates, and I. VVright,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to John Taylor. cf. NUC, pre-1956.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
